Proceedings of the Sixteenth International Congress of Papyrology (Chico, 1981) pp. 345-355.

The celebrations attending both Gaius' accession and his recovery from illness were remembered with a joy which spread over the empire. It seems possible that Gaius responded by reducing the tribute owed to Rome, as signalled in the registers from Philadelphia.
